title: Queen Maxima of the Netherlands sports a suit to speak at an international trade conference
text:
Queen Maxima of the Netherlands continued to reign high in the style stakes today as she sported a red suit to speak at the fifth Global SME Finance Forum in Schiphol.

The royal, 48, stepped out in head-to-toe deep red as she spoke about the development of small and medium-sized enterprises.

Sporting an open V-neck maroon shirt with a fashion-forward tassel detail, the monarch looked every inch the sartorial inspiration at the tech event.

Queen Maxima of the Netherlands continued to reign high in the style stakes today as she sported a red suit to speak at the fifth Global SME Finance Forum on October in Schiphol

The royal, 48, was head-to-toe in deep red as she spoke about the development of small and medium-sized enterprises. Sporting an open deep V neck maroon shirt with a fashion-forward tassel detail, the monarch looked every inch the sartorial inspiration at the tech event

Proving she's not one for half measures, Maxima ditched her usual penchant for big hats in exchange for a bright red lipstick and a shiny red shoe

To ensure she look sophisticated, Maxima paired the shirt with bright red trousers with a fold at the knee.

She paired the flowing bottoms with a matching suit jacket, which had an intricate button detail.

Proving she's not one for half measures, Maxima ditched her usual penchant for big hats in exchange for a bright red lipstick and shiny red shoe.

The only element of her outfit that wasn't red was the gold strap and lining of her patent handbag.

She paired the flowing bottoms with a matching suit jacket, which had an intricate button detail

To ensure she look sophisticated, Maxima paired the shirt with bright red trousers with a fold at the knee

Showing her ease for style and elegance, Maxima opted for a natural make-up look, wearing just a lick of mascara and a light bronzer on her face.

She wore no jewellery or accessories, letting the bright red look speak for itself.

An international financier by training, Máxima was born in Argentina and married into the Dutch royal family in 2002, three years after meeting her husband-to-be in Seville, Spain.

Showing her ease for style and elegance, Maxima opted for a natural make-up look, wearing just a lick of mascara and a light bronzer on her face

She wore no jewellery or accessories, letting the bright red look speak for itself

An international financier by training, Máxima was born in Argentina and married into the Dutch royal family in 2002, three years after meeting her husband-to-be in Seville, Spain

The mother-of-three daughters, Catharina-Amalia, 14, Alexia, 12, and Ariane, 10, married into the Dutch royal family in 2002.

She wasn't joined today by her husband Willem-Alexander, 52, who became king after his mother, Beatrix, abdicated in April 2013 after 33 years as reigning monarch.

Queen Maxima has reportedly said that she had no inkling that Willem-Alexander was heir to the throne when they first met.

The mother-of-three daughters, Catharina-Amalia, 14, Alexia, 12, and Ariane, 10, married into the Dutch royal family in 2002
description: Queen Maxima, 48, was head-to-toe in deep red as she spoke about the development of small and medium-sized enterprises at the Global SME Finance Forum in Schiphol.
